website_summaries.verdict: Starter ladder that's designed to hang from the exterior RV ladder to the ground.
pros: Perfect complement to your exterior RV ladder, as this 48-inch starter ladder has three steps so you can easily climb to the first rung on the main exterior ladder
Can be set at any angle to reach the main ladder properly
Secures tightly to the exterior ladder
cons: A bit of a hassle to carry this extra gear

customer_reviews.title: A very strong safety concern for these steps
customer_reviews.text: There honestly needs to be a safer way to climb these steps. They look good, Good construction but besides the straps that hold them to my ladder, it's an accident waiting to happen. I scratched up the back of my RV after I climbed the 3rd step. The steps swayed to the left and which made it very unstable. Returning them due to a safety concern.
customer_reviews.author: whitewolf

customer_reviews.title: Straps are a very, very tight fit.
customer_reviews.text: The straps do not fit around the ladder of my Thor Challenger. Using pliers, it appears I may be able to stretch them far enough to get the holes over the hooks, but I’m not confident I’ll be able to get them back off afterwards. The ladder does not fold, so it has to be removed before driving. I’m not sure I can use this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Priebe

customer_reviews.title: Height to reach the regular ladder on motor home!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a very short person and height is always a problem, this is being used on the ladder on the back of our 30 ft. motorhome. When we are camping in Georgia there is always leaves falling on the roof of it and I have to go up to sweep them off our roof. the ladder on the motor home itself is quit a bit off the ground and this additional ladder helps me to get up off the ground it is a lot safer then using a step ladder against the permanent ladder on the back of our motor home.
customer_reviews.author: sarah j Grabendike

customer_reviews.title: Rubber straps...bad
customer_reviews.text: Ladder worked great but the rubber straps that hold it on are garbage broke the first time. With a stronger bungee cord to hold it, it is a good ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Betty D.

customer_reviews.title: Good "first steps" ladder, but not heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice addition to my RV, and fits in my utilities cabinet just fine. No, not the strongest in the world, so if you're a little on the "portly" side, this will be too light. But for me at 175lbs it works fine. When I'm parked with the tail lower than the nose, it's a good jump to get up to first rung, so this really makes a world of difference.
customer_reviews.author: J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good extension, but not as strong as original equipment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to repair a damaged rv ladder, and it worked to accomplish this so I’m satisfied. Not as sturdy or strong as OEM, but acceptable
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Wow. This ladder really helps you get up on ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This ladder really helps you get up on top to place your cable DISH. Before we had to use our RV dining chair to reach the first rung of the ladder. We secure it to the existing ladder with a bungee cord when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it saves me from having to carry a step stool ...
customer_reviews.text: it saves me from having to carry a step stool to get to the first step of the mounted ladder
customer_reviews.author: A Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just the thing I needed. Fits well and will save me over stretching my body as I get older.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Too short.
customer_reviews.text: Too short to reach the ground on my motor home. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Orman

customer_reviews.title: Exact match
customer_reviews.text: I used the ladder to splice in a bad section on the roof access ladder. Worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Thein

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, very flimsy and not designed as they say it is.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: a little expensive, but a great item to have
customer_reviews.text: a must have to take the stress off from pulling the attached ladder off and to reach the first step with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Was a nice item for those that need it.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return item, was only a half a ladder, needed full ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: This unit serves the purpose it was designed for. Be sure to tighten the two rubber cap attachment screws before using, or the ladder will shift when you first use it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: a little short and rubber straps broke first trip out
customer_reviews.author: allan cummings

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: My husband put this extension on the ladder on the back of our 5th wheel. He secured it in several places for travel purposes. He's used it more than once and loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Zetah

product_meta.title: Stromberg Carlson LA148 Universal Outdoor Ladder for RV
product_meta.description: Get a leg up on climbing your coach's ladder to access your roof top maintenance with this 48" ladder. The hardware secures starter ladder to your coach's exterior ladder so it cannot get knocked off. This ladder will support up to 300 pounds at a 12 Degree angle.
feature_bullets: Get a leg up on climbing your coach's ladder
48" ladder is secured to coach's exterior ladder
Supports up to 250 lbs. at a 12 Degree angle
